languageKey.label: Layar layer source content description.
Each records describes a layer. Layer data is retrieved from the specified table and fields.
Contains the layer name used to uniquely identify this layer.
The layer name is used by the Layar API to identify the source.
Table used as provider for POI data.
System folder where the POI data is placed.
If no folder selected, all records from the database table are read.
Field name containing the POI title.
Typoscript used to generate the second line of POI details.
The typoscript data is run in the context of the POI record and is an stdWrap element.
Typoscript used to generate the third line of POI details.
The typoscript data is run in the context of the POI record and is an stdWrap element.
Typoscript used to generate the third line of POI details.
The typoscript data is run in the context of the POI record and is an stdWrap element.
Typoscript used to generate the attribution line of POI details.
The typoscript data is run in the context of the POI record and is an stdWrap element.
Field name(s) containing the actions values. Names are separated by comma.

If only one fieldname is provided, the field contains the list of actions separated by line breaks. Otherwise each specified fields contain one action. At most four actions are read. Empty fields / lines are skipped. If the corresponding label is empty, the action is skipped.
Field name(s) containing the actions labels. Names are separated by comma.

If only one fieldname is provided, the field contains the list of actions labels seperated by line breaks. Otherwise each specified fields contain one action label. Each label is associated with its action by order.
Field name providing a picture illustrating the POI.
Url can be recognized as full URL, absolute URL, site root relative url, or uploaded file name.
Field name containing the POI type or its value.
The value can only be in the range 0 to 3 inclusives.
Field name(s) containing the coordinates. Names are separated by comma.

If only one field name, the field contains the lattitude and the longitude in degrees separated by a comma. If two field names, the first field is the lattitude in degrees and the second is longitude in degrees.
